title: External tool as tab
author: Tacioandrade
body_snippet:
<!-- Feature Request -->

I would like to ask for it somehow when adding an external tool like Filezilla FTP, Mikrotik Winbox, Telnet, Tracert, Ping, etc. as an external tool, rather than opening a new window, open as a tab inside the own mRemoteNG, Is it possible to implement this in the tool?


Sincerely, T├ício Andrade.

comments.snippet: This is possible for some tools by checking the `Try to integrate` checkbox. Not all tools can be successfully integrated into mRemoteNG tabs.
comments.author: sparerd

comments.snippet:
Wouldn't it be possible to set the tools window's parent to be a tab control using the User32 SetParent method?

Something like this?
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5028598/hosting-external-app-in-wpf-window
comments.author: galamdring

comments.snippet: We can look into using SetParent, though it can cause odd issues (like the window focus bugs we see when using PuTTY).
comments.author: sparerd
